What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more about how to be a better storyteller through the visual media.

I learnt the proper formatting rules of screenwriting, as well as the different ways to capture an audience's attention in a script. I also learnt how to write script coverages and basic ground rules that a screenwriter follows.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the workshop sessions and wish there could have been more of them. I was also exposed to a lot of fun screenplays and movies throughout the class. More time could have been spent delving into the intricacies of a screenplay and discussing the different things that make a screenplay enjoyable or surprising. However, a lot of time was spent on lectures instead.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Totally! Especially if you're trying to figure out if you might have a thing for screenwriting

Yes. It is a good introduction level crash course to screenwriting. It covered the fundamentals of writing a screenplay while forcing us to work out the kinks of our stories within a short amount of time, which is good writing practice for working with a tight deadline.
